page.title: 16ROUND AND ABOUT ST.NEOTS.
page.content: {ST.NEOTS BYPASS.}The St.Neots Bypass, due to open in 1986 will alleviate many of the traffic problems which affect the centre of St. Neots town. The new road takes a southern route from the A45 near Tythe Farm to the A1 just south of Eaton Socon, crossing the River Great Ouse close to the site of the old Little Barford Power Station. Although it is only single carriage way it will remove both heavy and holiday traffic from the narrow High Street and town bridge. {PARKER'S FARM.}This is found on the B1046 and forms part of the Banks Estate. Each July Trials Fields of various cereal crops are viewed by members of the farming fraternity. Parker's Farm is typical of those in the locality being devoted almost entirely to the growing of cereal crops.
